lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into IntelliJ as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 21** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/PRTS.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run PRTS.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
The project comes with a set of test scripts for different operating systems:
These scripts will compile the source files, run the tests, and compare the output against the expected output.
Even in silence, you are still moving forward.
What you carry is heavy, but it is also proof that you endured.
Not every step needs to be seen to matter.
You are allowed to rest without giving up who you are.
The path is unclear, but your direction is honest.
Some days are meant for surviving, not winning.
If you are still here, then something within you chose hope.
